intro: Lipochaeta lavarum var. ovata, commonly known as the broadleaf lipochaeta, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are ovate and often have a hairy surface, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodlands.
